column2: ITP003 - Asphalt Production of Surface Mixes
column8: ITP003 - Asphalt Production of Surface Mixes

column2: Frequency: Not less than 48 hours prior to the commencement of a work period.

• Plan demonstrates that the hot storage capacity and production capacity of the mixing plant is capable of supplying asphalt to complete the work proposed to be undertaken within that work period on time and to make the runway suitable for aircraft operation in the event of an asphalt plant breakdown.
Frequency: Not less than once per work period. To be recorded at the time of taking bitumen volumetric readings.
• Temperature to be within the below range for the relevant bitumen type when introduced into the mixer:
– Polymer modified bitumen with warm mix additives: 140-175°C
Inspection/ Test Method: Asphalt plant temperature probe
Frequency: Not less than once per work period.
Acceptance Criteria: Temperature to be not more than 10°C above or more than 15°C below the temperature of the bitumen.
Inspection/ Test Method: Asphalt plant temperature probe
Frequency: Not less than once per work period.
Acceptance Criteria: Temperature to be within 10oC of the job mix temperature
Inspection/ Test Method: Asphalt plant temperature probe
Frequency: Once per work period for each production run for each nominal size of asphalt mix.
Inspection/ Test Method: Inspection of plant digital readouts before and after each production run
Frequency: Once per work period for each nominal size of asphalt mix.
Acceptance Criteria: Not less than the job bitumen content.
Inspection/ Test Method: Calculation: Daily bitumen usage divided by mass of asphalt produced for each mix type.
Frequency: Once per work period for each nominal size of asphalt mix.
Inspection/ Test Method: Inspection of plant digital readouts
Frequency: Prior notice (minimum 24 hours) of the time of bitumen delivery to mixing plant and the taking of samples to be given to Contract Administrator.
• One sample of not less than two (2) litres taken from each separate delivery vessel of bitumen delivered to the mixing plant.

• Containers are labelled appropriately so that samples are traceable to asphalt lots, manufacturing batch records and conformance reports. Samples are provided to Contract Administrator immediately after sampling.
2.02 - Sampling from storage tank at the asphalt mixing plant.
Frequency: Not more than four hours prior to the scheduled production start time for each work period.
• Duplicate samples are taken from the storage tank at the asphalt mixing plant.
• Containers are labelled appropriately so that samples are traceable to asphalt lots, manufacturing batch records and conformance reports.
• One sample is provided to Contract Administrator immediately after sampling; one sample is tested as per Section 2 of this ITP.
Frequency: One test prior to each work period, completed no later than 1 hour prior to start of asphalt production.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: One test prior to each work period, completed no later than 1 hour prior to start of asphalt production.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: One test prior to each work period, completed no later than 1 hour prior to start of asphalt production.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: One test weekly conducted on a Monday sampled from storage tank, regardless of whether work proceeds that day or not.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: No later than 1 hour prior to the scheduled start of asphalt production for each work period.
• Completion of the specified set of tests on polymer modified binder.
• Submission of test results and a statement to the Contract Administrator regarding the compliance of the binder in the tank.
Frequency: Not less than once per work period.
• Percentage of coating of particles in the mix, when sampled at the point of loading, must not be less than 97% and a homogeneous mixture must be obtained.
Inspection/ Test Method: Visual inspection as per ASTM D2489 methodology
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
Acceptance Criteria: ±3.0 compared to job mix but not less than 12.0 kN (for 14mm NMS) or not less than 10.0 kN (for 10mm NMS)
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
Acceptance Criteria: Max 3.0 mm for unmodified binder; max ±1.0 mm compared to job mix for PMB
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
3.06 - Minimum and maximum voids filled with bitumen
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
• Within acceptable range of deviation from job mix aggregate particle size distribution:
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
Acceptance Criteria: Within ±0.3 of job bitumen content by mass.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
Frequency: Each test set sampled from asphalt delivery trucks (as per AS 2891.1). See Note 1 for sampling frequency.
Record of conformity: NATA-accredited test certificate
• Number of test sets on asphalt of each nominal size in work period:
Quantity of asphalt produced || Number of sets of tests
• Minimum number of tests per work period regardless of tonnes produced: 3
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
